bio: I'm a temporary research fellow at the Institute of Informatics and Telematics (IIT) of the National Research Council (CNR) working in a group called Web Applications for the Future Internet (WAFI). In the mean time I'm a third year Ph.D. student in Information Engineering at the University of Pisa. My interests are mainly focused on data visualization and Web technologies while my research activities cover Information Visualization and Semantic Web.

nodes.name: Research fellow
nodes.location: National Research Council (CNR), Institute of Informatics and Telematics (IIT)

nodes.location: Complex Systems and Artificial Intelligence (CSAI) Research Center

nodes.name: Linked Data DoGi
nodes.description: DoGi is a database containing bibliographic references of articles published on italian juridical journals. The DoGi project consists in the translation of this relational database with Semantic Web Technologies. Moreover, Information Visualization techniques have been used in order to present the dataset.

nodes.name: Smartarea
nodes.description: The activity performed in the Smartarea project consists in the design and development of a 3D-interactive map built using Three.js that allows to find places and get directions within the CNR campus in Pisa.

nodes.name: Fractal Maps
nodes.description: This activity has the aim of creating a new way for exploring and navigating big Linked Data sets employing Information Visualization techniques. Two applications, DBpedia Atlas and LinkedMDB Atlas, have been developed.

nodes.name: Text Encoder and Annotator: an all-in-one editor for transcribing and annotating manuscripts with RDF (Extended Version)
Linked Data Maps: Providing a Visual Entry Point for the Exploration of Datasets
DBpedia Atlas: Mapping the Uncharted Lands of Linked Data
ASIA - An Investigation Platform for Exploiting Open Source Information in the Fight against Tax Evasion

nodes.name: Spacetime: a Two Dimensions Search and Visualisation Engine Based on Linked Data
nodes.conference: International Conference on Advances in Semantic Processing
